changes: Added mode property to renderAgents function call - passes state.mode to the agents view
file_insights.role: Parent component that orchestrates rendering and passes mode down

changes: Added AppMode type import from navigation.ts
Added mode to AgentsProps type definition
Created isBasic constant to check mode
Modified renderAgentTabs function signature to accept isBasic parameter
Added tab filtering logic - Basic mode shows only overview and files tabs, Advanced shows all tabs
file_insights.role: View component that implements mode-aware tab rendering

patterns_discovered: Mode-aware UI rendering - passing AppMode prop through component hierarchy
Conditional array filtering based on mode - `isBasic ? allTabs.filter(...) : allTabs`
Prop drilling pattern - mode passed from app-render.ts → renderAgents → renderAgentTabs
Type-safe mode checking with explicit string comparison `props.mode === "basic"`
gotchas_discovered: Required adding type import for AppMode from navigation.ts
Had to modify function signatures to pass mode/flag through
Parent component (app-render.ts) needed to pass mode to child component
discoveries.approach_outcome: SUCCESS - Implemented in first attempt. The mode-aware rendering correctly filters tabs: Basic mode shows only Overview and Files tabs (2 tabs), Advanced mode shows all 6 tabs. The implementation is clean with a simple boolean flag (isBasic) passed through to control rendering behavior.
recommendations: Apply similar mode-aware rendering to other views (e.g., tools.ts, skills.ts) for consistency
Consider extracting mode-aware tab filtering into a reusable utility function
Document the mode-aware pattern for future contributors
The filtering approach (filter array based on condition) is clean and can be reused for other mode-specific UI elements
